faq.title: What is Vanced
faq.description:
YouTube Vanced is a modified version of Google's YouTube app that adds features and tweaks to make your YouTube experience better!

Such things include:

Background playback
Custom themes (normal dark, OLED black, bright pink, or sky blue)
(Most) ads are gone
Override max resolution
And much, much more!
For a full list, check out the "features" drop-down in the XDA thread. The link to that (and other general info) can be found in the here(https://forum.xda-developers.com/android/apps-games/app-youtube-vanced-edition-t3758757)

faq.title: Video Download
faq.description:
Downloading videos is only available in these(https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6141269) countries & you can download any video which is FREE to download. Videos needing YouTube Premium will never get downloaded so if you see YT premium dialogue when downloading some videos, BUY YouTube PREMIUM FOR IT.

Note this again, "VANCED IS NOT YOUTUBE PREMIUM". 

You could use some apps like NewPipe, Videoder, Tubemate, SnapTube, or a Telegram bot to download videos if don't live in one of the supported countries. Please do not ask for links of these apps in group.

⚠️⚠️Vanced will never add any sort of third party downloader to the app.⚠️ Not only it is a hassle for the developers to maintain, but it also gives Google one more reason to send a takedown notice, meaning that the development will be ceased for Vanced.

Nobody wants that, so downloading from other sources/YouTube videos from within the Vanced app will never be supported. Please don’t ask if the developers can add that feature. If you can’t download from the Vanced app, then use one of the alternative apps above.⚠️

faq.title: Swipe gesture issue
faq.description: If you have enabled "old comments" from youtube settings/vanced settings/layout, disable it and restart app to check. If that doesnt work, try clearing app data and cache. If even that doesnt work, report on our github repo. Be sure to look previous issues before creating one new.

faq.title: Captions not available
faq.description:
For various issues like captions not available or info button not there, read this:
Not every videos have subtitles, info buttons, etc. and this is not any bug from vanced. Please check on official YouTube app and desktop site(www.youtube.com) for such issue before reporting. 

Its totally depends upon those video uploader's who are not including subtitles or not providing any information to be given with info button and vanced have nothing to do with it. 

TL;DR: Its not YouTube Vanced issue, please check official YouTube app or desktop site for these things before reporting as not every videos have them.

faq.title: Why Split apks
faq.description:
First of all, what are split apks and how do we benefit from them:

1.  What are split apks?
It's a zip file which contains the base apk, config apk for your device architecture and language apk.

For example, a typical normal apk has both 32 bit and 64 bit support file, lots of language files and a base apk. So if your device is only 32 bit for example and you only want english language file, why would you want an extra files which you don't even need and will result in taking huge space in your storage.

> Advantages:
  • size of split apk is almost half of normal apk
  • a split apk only has those files which are relevant for your device and architecture

> Disadvantages:
  Difficult to newbies or non-technical people

2. Why split?

Google only distributes the YouTube APKs after version 14.54 in split APKs now , so in order to install Vanced, we have to use SAI (Split APK Installer).
Previously, they provides normal apk making it easy to install apps on every device.

3. why dev's don't patch apks and make apk from it?

It's not like that they can't. It's about increased time in doing this. Converting from apks to apk adds time which they can use that in other ways(both personal and vanced bugs/updates). So please don't ask how to get normal apk. Use old version if you are really lazy or official YT app from play store directly.

faq.title: App Splash color
faq.description:
Splash screen background color is now taken from Android framework color (Android system) to make sure Vanced/Youtube changes its splash According to system theme. Whatever be the Android framework color, the same color vanced will show.

You can use Substratum/Swift themes to change the theme color.

faq.title: Redownload
faq.description:
The reason is pretty simple: sometimes downloaded file can be corrupted, trying to grab them and install will result in infinite loop of failure, to avoid this manager redownloads files every time you press button.

However, Non-Root installer can now use the already downloaded files to reinstall Vanced.

faq.title: Microphone
faq.description:
If you're wondering why there is no microphone permission in the root version of Vanced, that's because the APK used to modify Vanced (minAPI17) is missing the microphone permission. The other APK has it (minAPI21) but that lacks the translation. Why? Ask Google 🤷‍♂️

Workaround: use the non-root variant, or stock YouTube.

NOTE: These issues only exists in version 14 and below. The permissions are now fixed from version 15.

faq.title: Exoplayer
faq.description:
1. What is Exoplayer?
ExoPlayer is an application level media player for Android. It provides an alternative to Android’s MediaPlayer API for playing audio and video both locally and over the Internet. ExoPlayer supports features not currently supported by Android’s MediaPlayer API, including DASH and SmoothStreaming adaptive playbacks. Unlike the MediaPlayer API, ExoPlayer is easy to customize and extend, and can be updated through Play Store application updates.

2. Difference between V1 and V2?
V1:

  > Better optimised for low end devices. 

  > Can switch to v1 if V2 starts giving issues to you.

V2: 

  > not supported by low end devices. Might give issues on low end crashes, can cause crashes, glitches, lags, black screen. 

  > More optimised for latest devices released after 2019

NOTE: With version 15.33.34, Exoplayer V2 is forced by Google so if V2 gives issue on your device, switch to V1.

PSA: ExoPlayer V2 is EXPERIMENTAL, don't use it unless you know what you're doing. Don't report crashes if you have it enabled. If you are facing crashes/lags/glitches/etc, Switch to Exoplayer v1.

faq.title: Developer Options
faq.description: In vanced settings, tap about section 6-7 times to unlock secret menu. This menu only enables the additional video codec settings.

faq.title: Core
faq.description:
If you having issues related to microG core & vanced and looking for an answer here’s a list so far of what can be done:

1. You need to have at least Pico Gapps to run vanced.

2. You can’t run vanced with microG core because it needs Google Play Services Framework which is available in all Gapps packages.

3. If you are worried about your privacy & don’t want to use Gapps but still want to use Vanced then there are old Nokia phones still available in the market. :)

faq.title: Chromecast
faq.description:
As of Vanced version 14.21.54 and MicroG version 0.2.6.17455, Chromecast should work by default. If it doesn't, connect to the chromecast with the regular version of youtube. You can then add videos/control using YouTube Vanced.

NOTE: Microg V0.2.11 fixed Chromecast so be sure to update your microg versions if you are running 0.2.10 or lower.

faq.title: Apk Signing
faq.description:
In newest Vanced versions till V15.40.37, you should disable apk signature verification in order to install Vanced using Split Apk Installer, but many users choose "sign apk" option in SAI which will cause crashes in Vanced. 

*Do not enable options you weren't asked to enable! *

In order to solve crashes, just reinstall Vanced but this time disable sign apk option in SAI.

faq.title: App Drawer
faq.description:
If YT Vanced app is not visible in your app drawer, follow these steps:

• Install regular YouTube app from the Google Play Store

• Open the app until your front page shows up (not sure if this is necessary. Just reconstructing what's been working for others all the time).

• Go to Settings > Apps > YouTube. It should show "Uninstall" on the top left. DO NOT Uninstall! Just see if it says that there!

• Reboot

• Go to Settings > Apps > YouTube. Now it should say "Disable" or "Deactivate". DO NOT Uninstall! Just see if it says that there!

• In the same menu; tap on the three dot menu button on the upper right corner and tap on "Remove/Uninstall Updates".

Now the YT Vanced app should show in your launcher.

OR

[Follow this link](https://forum.xda-developers.com/showpost.php?p=75068670&postcount=299) if above solution didn't work for you.

faq.title: Videos Not Playing
faq.description:
If a video is buffering on browser or app and not playing, it is HWC or mediaserver issue. Change your ROM or update it up to latest to fix your issue else report to ROM developers.

If you are using some custom skins, then you can try checking the issue in youtube app and report to your device community so that they can bring a fix in next update for you.

There's nothing else we can do since issue is from ROM side.

faq.title: 480p issue due to Covid-19 Pandamic
faq.description:
It's NOT vanced bug/issue. It's youtube doing due to lockdown in various countries to limit data usage and huge traffic. So that every user can browse/surf on internet without much issues.

However, YouTube has lifted this cap now. So you can ignore whatever being said below. If you still have 480p as maximum while the video resolution showing on desktop is higher, you can use below workaround as a temporary fix until Google removes the cap in your region/on your network.

PLEASE NOTE: 

• Anything happens on YouTube, happens on YouTube vanced since everything is controlled by YouTube servers.

fields.title: Workarounds
fields.content:
1) You can try with VPN if you are lucky. YouTube applied this in most countries so you have to pick your new region wisely.

2) Watch on desktop mode [www(dot)youtube(dot)com]

3) Since the 480p restriction is only for mobile devices and not tablets we can change the model of the device in YouTube Vanced to overcome the restriction.

a) Open YouTube Vanced

b) Enable additional options by going to Settings -> Vanced Settings -> Tap on the About section till you get a message saying hidden Menu is visible

c) Go to Codec override -> Override model and enter the model number of any tab e.g. "SM-T865" and device to "Samsung"

d) Restart the app and the 480p limit should be gone now

e) Enjoy

faq.title: How to hide Vanced microG notification
faq.description:
To hide notification of microg from notification panel, disable battery optimisation for microg. If notification doesn't hide, reboot device and it will get fixed.

If even after doing above, notification doesn't go away, 

1. just tap and hold onto that notification

2. tap settings icon on the right and,

3. toggle off notification from there(battery saving exclusion) and notification will no longer appear.

faq.title: High Resolution
faq.description:
If your device only supports 720p/1080p resolution, you can still play videos up to 4k only but the video will be scaled down back to your device's native resolution and not true 4k. 

Only true 4k resolution can be seen on flagship devices (SD855).

To enable high resolutions, head to Vanced settings > video settings and turn on "resolution checks" then restart the app.
